/*THIS FILE REPRODUCES THE ESTIMATES OF STUDY 1:
FIGURE 1 
TABLE 1

TABLE A3 IN THE APPENDIX
*/

/*
Hardware: MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2017)
Software: macOS Mojave 10.14.1; stata 15 
Sources of data-sets used in study 1: 
Dutch election study 2002/03: https://www.nkodata.nl/study_units/view/8 (ungated) 
German election study 1983: https://dbk.gesis.org/dbksearch/sdesc2.asp?no=1276&db=e&doi=10.4232/1.11458 (gated)
*/

/*
ssc install g538schemes, replace all
set scheme 538w, permanently
ssc install estout, replace all
*/
*create a little wrapper to export no. of clusters:

options.value: "{bf:Did public polarization increase after the LPF entry? Yes.}"
"Did polarization increase after the LPF entrance (Netherlands 2002)? Yes."
"Models (1)-(3) clustered standard errors by panel id;} \\ \multicolumn{5}{l}{\footnotesize Model (5) propensity score matching, 1-match per respondent before Fortuyn murder;"
"{bf:Who shifted? Left vs. right party identifiers}"
"{bf:Who shifted? Shifts for set of party identifiers}"
"{it:(based on pre-election set of party identifiers)}"
"Is there a backlash \& legitimization effect after LPF enters? Yes."
"Tobit models: Is there a backlash \& legitimization effect after LPF enters? Yes."
"Did polarization increase after Green entrance (Germany 1983)? No."

"all models use clustered standard errors by panel id;} \\ \multicolumn{4}{l}{\footnotesize  controls (age, gender, urban vs. rural, social class,;} \\ \multicolumn{4}{l}{\footnotesize  voting preference, political knowledge, religiosity) omitted from table."
